snippet: Several companies offered to take on the project for the government, which is expected to choose a developer and one of its final three sites next year.
abstract: Major commercial real estate developers scramble to prepare bids to construct new 2.1-million-square-feet FBI headquarters in Washington, DC; financial requirements for project include minimum of $1 billion in liquid assets; winning bidder will gain right to tear down aging J Edgar Hoover Building and redevelop its prime real estate, though return will not come for at least a decade.
lead_paragraph: Several companies offered to take on the project for the government, which is expected to choose a developer and one of its final three sites next year.

headline.main: New F.B.I. Headquarters Enters the Bidding Phase
headline.print_headline: New F.B.I. Headquarters Enters the Bidding Phase
